definition: to die without regret (idiom, from Analects)
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to regret

sentences.english: I have been to Naples and die.
sentences.chinese: 我去过那不勒斯，死而无悔。

definition: to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
to die without regrets (idiom); to sacrifice oneself without hesitation
to meet death
to give one's body for the nation (idiom); to spend one's whole life in the service of the country
heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
lit. although dead, as if still alive (idiom); still with us in spirit
until death puts an end (idiom); one's whole life/unto one's dying day
ten thousand deaths will not prevent me (idiom); ready to risk life and limb to help out
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
to offer one's life in sacrifice
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
lit. although dead, also honored; died a glorious death
in peril/facing disaster
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
